thread.title: Injury forces Keira Knightley to miss Broadway show
thread.title_full: Injury forces Keira Knightley to miss Broadway show

title: Injury forces Keira Knightley to miss Broadway show
text:
Injury forces Keira Knightley to miss Broadway show The Associated Press FILE - In this Jan. 20, 2014 file photo, actress Keira Knightley attends the European Premiere of "Jack Ryan: Shadow Recruit," in London. Knightley ™s Broadway debut was interrupted Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015, when a member of the audience shouted at the actress and threw a bouquet of flowers at the stage before being escorted from the theater. Knightley, who plays the title character in the play œThÃ©rÃ¨se Raquin  was onstage with Gabriel Ebert when the disturbance took place at the Studio 54 Theatre, the same location where last year actor Shia LaBeouf was handcuffed during a performance of œCabaret  for yelling obscenities. (Photo by Jon Furniss Photography/Invision/AP, File) By Mark Kennedy, The Associated Press Oct. 7, 2015 4:50 p.m. (0) Comments 
NEW YORK (AP) - These are trying times at the Broadway show "Therese Raquin" - first a show was interrupted by a man in the audience who threw flowers and now star Keira Knightley has had to withdraw from Wednesday's performance. 
Roundabout Theatre Company said "a minor injury" to Knightley has forced the evening show to be canceled. The theater company expects her to be ready for Thursday night's show. 
This isn't the first time the show has made news even before it opens. 
Knightley, who plays the title character in the play, was onstage Oct. 1 with Gabriel Ebert when a young man in the mezzanine got up, went to the railing and shouted. When security arrived, the man tossed the flowers on his way out. © 2015 , Journal Sentinel Inc. All rights reserved.
